history.content:
3 classes over the summer is a lot...consider that the summer is half the length of a regular semester, so 3 summer classes is like 6 regular classes, but for only 8 weeks...

That said, if you manage your time extremely well, and your math is better than decent, then the load isn't outrageous. I'd still recommend 2 at most. 61B will probably be the largest workload of 3. 

-----------------

That seems fairly reasonable, but you may get stretched a bit at midterm season.

In terms of work, the two maths can be about the same, depending on the quality of 54's instruction. 61B is always a not small amount of work, but that's healthy :).

If you manage your time well, you can probably also take another humanities course with those, but probably not another tech.

children.subject: Oh. That's much more reasonable. Yea those 3 together during a regular semester is solid.
Just to clarify, I am asking for Fall 2017 (not summer)!

history.content: What @Nicole Evans McIntyre said: 3 classes over the summer is a lot...consider that the summer is half the length of a regular semester, so 3 summer classes is like 6 regular classes, but for only 8 weeks...

Hi, I am a current freshman (intended Applied Math & CS) who is considering taking Math 53, Math 54, and CS61B next semester (Fall 2017).

I would appreciate any suggestions/advice for managing these courses and as to whether the schedule seems decent overall.

Thanks!
history.subject: Possible to take 53/54 and 61B together?
